Review Title: Excellent people - No opportunity for advancement
Pros: Teams consist of driven and exceptional talents at all skill levels. Team members are extremely generous with their time and willing to work with you to expand your understanding in an area. Product-based company, so the work remains diverse and focused on delivering new features instead of becoming repetitive or overly iterative. Tremendous opportunity for ownership of work. Even junior engineers will be actively engaged in architecting new solutions and features. Rewarding work experience. Excellent support and engagement from managers and product owners.
Cons: Salary bumps do not keep up with inflation. Little to no opportunity for advancement if you enter as an engineer and not a manager. Constant executive turnover. You won't know the names of anyone except the CEO. HR executive turnover constantly leads to new "initiatives" which manifest as delaying and rescheduling bonuses and raises. Teams are heavily siloed. You won't know who to talk to about another product. Engineer-to-engineer collaboration isn't encouraged between teams. Salaries are well below industry average. Diversity and Inclusion efforts have unfortunately taken a front seat from corporate over embracing natural diversity. You WILL feel excluded and unimportant if you don't fit into one of the communities being pandered to.

Pros: Above average OTE and lots of potential but very poor planning and execution.
Cons: Poor strategy and vision makes almost impossible to succeed.

Cons: Long hours and hard work overall are

Review Title: Terrible Executive Management... but OK to work at as stepping stone in your career
Pros:
Some smart and nice individual contributors across the company.

If you can get that next title level then it can be worth being here for 18 months knowing that you are already working towards your next job outside of Hitachi Vantara.

Most people don't really care anymore so if you are decent at your job you can pretty much be on cruise control and have a really good work life balance.
Cons:
The most dysfunctional exec team I've ever experienced. The carousel of CEOs hasn't helped and the current one GK is a joke. Leading from behind but a total blowhard at the same time. The CHRO is a complete empty suit and somehow makes things worse every time he talks about employees. The CPO is so out of her depth its embarrassing.


Absolutely zero operating process and tools. Kind of amazing that the company is able to as much annual business despite itself.
